functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: What years were the top 5 universities in the UK, as ranked by The Complete University Guide in 2024, established?
What years were the top 5 universities in the UK, as ranked by The Complete University Guide in 2024, established?

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"query":"The Complete University Guide 2024 top universities in the UK"}

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"query":"The Complete University Guide 2024 top universities in the UK"}

No page with that title exists. Try searching for one of these similar articles instead:

msg.content:
<document>
<title>University of Oxford</title>
<fragment>
176. **^** "Guardian University Guide 2024". *The Guardian*. 9 September 2023.
177. **^** "Good University Guide 2024". *The Times*. 15 September 2023.
178. **^** "Academic Ranking of World Universities 2023". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. 15 August 2023.
179. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2025". Quacquarelli Symonds Ltd. 4 June 2024.
180. **^** "THE World University Rankings 2024". Times Higher Education. 28 September 2023.
181. **^** "World University Rankings". *Times Higher Education*. 26 September 2018. Archived from the original on 21 October 2018. Retrieved 28 September 2018.
182. **^** Adams, Susan. "An Expert List of the World's Best Universities". *Forbes*. Archived from the original on 28 September 2018. Retrieved 28 September 2018.
183. **^** Strauss, Karsten (23 September 2016). "The World's Top Universities 2016". *Forbes*. Archived from the original on 30 July 2017. Retrieved 20 October 2016.

</fragment>
<fragment>
184. **^** "Oxford tops Times Good University Guide for 11th year". University of Oxford. 14 June 2012. Archived from the original on 25 April 2013. Retrieved 30 December 2012.
185. **^** "Times Higher Education Clinical, Pre-Clinical & Health". 14 September 2017. Archived from the original on 10 November 2017. Retrieved 25 December 2017.
186. **^** "SCImago Institutions Rankings – Higher Education – All Regions and Countries – 2021 – Overall Rank". *scimagoir.com*. Archived from the original on 22 April 2019. Retrieved 11 June 2019.
187. **^** Morgan, John (January 1990). "Top Six Universities Dominate THE World Reputation Rankings". Archived from the original on 4 April 2014. Retrieved 7 June 2014. "The rankings suggest that the top six-...Stanford University and the University of Oxford – form a group of globally recognised "super brands".
188. **^** "Best Global Universities". *US News*. Archived from the original on 13 January 2016.

</fragment>
<fragment>

Oxford was ranked 13th in the world in 2022 by the Nature Index, which measures the largest contributors to papers published in 82 leading journals.[190][191] It is ranked fifth best university worldwide and first in Britain for forming CEOs according to the *Professional Ranking World Universities*,[192] and first in the UK for the quality of its graduates as chosen by the recruiters of the UK's major companies.[193]


In the 2018 Complete University Guide, all 38 subjects offered by Oxford rank within the top 10 nationally meaning Oxford was one of only two multi-faculty universities (along with Cambridge) in the UK to have 100% of their subjects in the top 10.[194] Computer Science, Medicine, Philosophy, Politics and Psychology were ranked first in the UK by the guide.[195]


</fragment>
<fragment>
189. **^** "Global MBA Ranking 2019". *Financial Times*. 12 September 2019. Archived from the original on 12 September 2019. Retrieved 12 September 2019.
190. **^** "Ten institutions that dominated science in 2022". Archived from the original on 14 December 2021. Retrieved 28 May 2019.
191. **^** "Introduction to the Nature Index". Archived from the original on 1 April 2019. Retrieved 28 May 2019.
192. **^** Mines ParisTech Professional Ranking World Universities. "Classement 2011 des universités par l Ecole des Mines le french ranking par excellence". Archived from the original on 25 September 2015.
193. **^** "The best UK universities chosen by major employers". *Times Higher Education*. London. 12 November 2015. Archived from the original on 4 March 2016. Retrieved 16 November 2015.
194. **^** "Who's Who in the Subject League Tables". Complete University Guide. Archived from the original on 7 July 2017. Retrieved 12 May 2017.

</fragment>
<fragment>
120. **^** "Widening participation: UK Performance Indicators: Table T2a – Participation of under-represented groups in higher education". *Higher Education Statistics Authority*. hesa.ac.uk. Archived from the original on 6 February 2023. Retrieved 8 February 2023.
121. **^** "Good University Guide: Social Inclusion Ranking". *The Times*. 16 September 2022. Archived from the original on 22 February 2022. Retrieved 12 February 2023.
122. **^** "Oxbridge 'Elitism'" (PDF). 9 June 2014. Archived (PDF) from the original on 7 March 2016. Retrieved 29 February 2016.
123. **^** "Acceptances to Oxford and Cambridge Universities by previous educational establishment". Archived from the original on 20 December 2016. Retrieved 17 September 2017.

</fragment>
</document>

<document>
<title>University of Cambridge</title>
<fragment>
153. **^** "Oldest printing and publishing house". Guinnessworldrecords.com. 22 January 2002. Archived from the original on 24 October 2012. Retrieved 28 March 2012.
154. **^** Black, Michael (1984). *Cambridge University Press, 1583–1984*. pp. 328–9. ISBN 978-0-521-66497-4.
155. **^** "Financial statements of the University of Cambridge" (PDF). November 2022. Archived (PDF) from the original on 11 March 2023. Retrieved 13 April 2023.
156. **^** "About OCR – Oxford and Cambridge and RSA Examinations". OCR. Archived from the original on 4 January 2013. Retrieved 3 January 2013.
157. **^** "Complete University Guide 2025". The Complete University Guide. 14 May 2024.
158. **^** "Guardian University Guide 2024". *The Guardian*. 9 September 2023.
159. **^** "Good University Guide 2024". *The Times*. 15 September 2023.
160. **^** "Academic Ranking of World Universities 2023". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. 15 August 2023.
161. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2025". Quacquarelli Symonds Ltd. 4 June 2024.

</fragment>
<fragment>
103. **^** "University League Tables entry standards 2024". *The Complete University Guide*. Archived from the original on 25 January 2021. Retrieved 7 June 2023.
104. **^** "Where do HE students study?: Students by HE provider". *HESA*. HE student enrolments by HE provider. Archived from the original on 4 November 2020. Retrieved 8 February 2023.
105. **^** "Who's studying in HE?: Personal characteristics". HESA. 31 January 2023. Archived from the original on 10 February 2023. Retrieved 8 February 2023.
106. **^** "Widening participation: UK Performance Indicators: Table T2a – Participation of under-represented groups in higher education". *Higher Education Statistics Authority*. hesa.ac.uk. Archived from the original on 6 February 2023. Retrieved 8 February 2023.
107. **^** "Good University Guide: Social Inclusion Ranking". *The Times*. 16 September 2022. Archived from the original on 22 February 2022. Retrieved 12 February 2023.

</fragment>
<fragment>
167. **^** Morgan, John. "Top Six Universities Dominate THE World Reputation Rankings". Archived from the original on 31 March 2015. Retrieved 29 July 2017. "The rankings suggest that the top six-...Stanford University and the University of Oxford – form a group of globally recognised "super brands".
168. **^** "QS World University Rankings (2010)". Archived from the original on 3 April 2011.
169. **^** "QS World University Rankings (2011)". Archived from the original on 1 October 2011.
170. **^** "Thomson Scientific ranks UK research". Thomson Scientific. 4 May 2006. Archived from the original on 21 August 2008. Retrieved 8 September 2008.
171. **^** "Cambridge continues its domination of research resources". *Times Higher Education*. 20 October 2006. Archived from the original on 18 May 2015. Retrieved 9 May 2015.
172. **^** Sheinman, Anna (4 January 2012). "Inside Cambridge: Fizz, Fellows and Formal Hall". *Huffington Post*. Archived from the original on 11 January 2012. Retrieved 9 May 2015.

</fragment>
<fragment>
162. **^** "THE World University Rankings 2024". Times Higher Education. 28 September 2023.
163. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2023: Top Global Universities". *Top Universities*. Archived from the original on 17 September 2012. Retrieved 8 June 2022.
164. **^** "ShanghaiRanking's Academic Ranking of World Universities". *www.shanghairanking.com*. Archived from the original on 15 August 2019. Retrieved 1 March 2023.
165. **^** "World University Rankings". *Times Higher Education (THE)*. 25 August 2021. Archived from the original on 25 February 2023. Retrieved 12 October 2022.
166. **^** "QS World University Rankings by Subject 2022". *Top Universities*. Archived from the original on 26 October 2022. Retrieved 8 April 2022.

</fragment>
<fragment>

![](image)University of Cambridge's national league table performance over the past ten years
The University of Cambridge is routinely ranked among the world's top five universities, and has sometimes been ranked as the world's best. As of 2023, the University of Cambridge is ranked the second-best university in the world behind the MIT and the best university in Europe by *QS Rankings*.[163] *ARWU* ranks Cambridge the fourth-best university in the world as of 2023 behind Harvard, Stanford, and MIT.[164] *Times Higher Education* ranks Cambridge third-best in the world (tied with Stanford) in its 2023 rankings behind Oxford and Harvard.[165]


</fragment>
</document>

msg.name: search

msg.content:
<document>
<title>University College London</title>
<fragment>
233. ^ ***a*** ***b*** ***c*** "Guardian University Guide 2024". *The Guardian*. 9 September 2023.
234. ^ ***a*** ***b*** ***c*** "Good University Guide 2024". *The Times*. 15 September 2023.
235. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "Academic Ranking of World Universities 2023". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. 15 August 2023.
236. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "QS World University Rankings 2025". Quacquarelli Symonds Ltd. 4 June 2024.
237. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "THE World University Rankings 2024". Times Higher Education. 28 September 2023.
238. **^** Thomas, Zoe (11 October 2009). "UK universities top the league table in Europe". *The Sunday Times*. London. Archived from the original on 16 July 2011. Retrieved 28 September 2010.
239. **^** Richard Adams (11 September 2021). "'Always hungry to do better': how UCL rose up the rankings". *The Guardian*.
240. **^** "UCL (University College London)". The Complete University Guide. Retrieved 8 February 2023.

</fragment>
<fragment>
173. **^** "Oxbridge windfall". *Times Higher Education*. 4 August 1995. A large amount of the cash awarded to humanities postgraduates still goes to the "Golden Triangle" of Oxford, Cambridge and London, British Academy figures reveal.
174. **^** Kershaw, Alison (4 October 2012). "UK universities slip in rankings". *The Independent*. Rankings editor Phil Baty said: "Outside the golden triangle of London, Oxford and Cambridge, England's world-class universities face a collapse into global mediocrity
175. **^** "UCL joins League of European Research Universities". University College London. Archived from the original on 5 August 2014. Retrieved 9 August 2014.
176. **^** "Our members". *League of European Research Universities*. Archived from the original on 5 February 2022. Retrieved 2 February 2023.
177. **^** "Our members". *Association of Commonwealth Universities*. Retrieved 2 February 2023.
178. **^** "Member directory". *European University Association*. Retrieved 2 February 2023.

</fragment>
<fragment>

![](image)University College London's national league table performance over the past ten years
National
UCL is ranked as one of the top ten universities in all three of the main UK university league tables.[232][233][234] These place more emphasis on teaching and student experience than global rankings, using criteria such as teaching quality and learning resources, entry standards, employment prospects, research quality and dropout rates.[238] It went through a dip in rankings in recent years, particularly in *The Guardian University Guide*, but returned to the top ten in 2022, when its ninth position was its best result in that table since 2014.[239]


In the 2023 *Complete University Guide* subject tables, UCL was ranked in the top ten in 34 subjects out of 42 offered (81%). It was ranked top for American studies, linguistics, speech and language therapy, and building.[240]


</fragment>
<fragment>

In the 2023 *Guardian University Guide* subject tables, UCL is ranked top in construction, surveying and planning. It was ranked in the top ten for 21 of 31 subjects offered (68%).[233]


UCL is ranked top in the 2023 *Times/Sunday Times Good University Guide* for American studies, building, information systems and management, liberal arts, and town and country planning. It is ranked in the top ten for 31 of 44 subjects offered (70%). The 2023 *Good University Guide* also ranked UCL 98th in their social inclusion ranking (covering England and Wales). UCL was named University of the Year in the *Times/Sunday Times Good University Guide* for 2024.[234]


Analysis by the Department for Education in 2018, found that UCL had an impact on earnings of graduates five years after graduation of +15.5% for women (7th highest impact) and +16.2% for men (10th highest impact) compared to average graduates with similar background characteristics (prior attainment, socio-economic status, etc.) and subject choice.[241]




</fragment>
<fragment>
Global
UCL has been consistently ranked in the top 25 of the three major global rankings published over 2013 to 2022, including being in the top ten of the *QS World University Rankings* over the whole of that period.[242][243][244]


In the 2022 *Academic Ranking of World Universities*, UCL was ranked 18th in the world,[235] having been placed between 15th and 21st in the rankings from 2013 to 2022.[242]


In the 2023 *QS World University Rankings* (published 2022), UCL was ranked 8th in the world.[236] It has ranked between 4th and 10th in the 2014 to 2024 league tables.[243]


In the *Times Higher Education* World University Rankings 2023 (published 2022), UCL was ranked 22nd in the world,[237] having ranked between 14th and 22nd in the 2014 to 2023 tables.[244] In the *Times Higher Education* World Reputation Rankings 2022, UCL was ranked 25th, while in the *Times Higher Education* Impact Rankings 2022 it was ranked 101–200.[244]


</fragment>
</document>

msg.name: search

msg.content:
Here are the establishment years for the top 5 universities in the UK, as ranked by The Complete University Guide in 2024:

1. **University of Oxford**: Established in 1096.
2. **University of Cambridge**: Established in 1209.
3. **London School of Economics (LSE)**: Established in 1895.
4. **Imperial College London**: Established in 1907.
5. **University College London (UCL)**: Established in 1826.

Here are the establishment years for the top 5 universities in the UK, as ranked by The Complete University Guide in 2024:

1. **University of Oxford**: Established in 1096.
2. **University of Cambridge**: Established in 1209.
3. **London School of Economics (LSE)**: Established in 1895.
4. **Imperial College London**: Established in 1907.
5. **University College London (UCL)**: Established in 1826.
